title: Level A1
description: This test estimates if your grammar level corresponds to A1 level. If you get 100% right answers it is higly likely you have A1 or higher in Grammar.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: I'm a doctor and my sister are a nurse.
I be a doctor and my sister are a nurse.
I am a doctor and my sister am a nurse.
correctAnswers: I'm a doctor and my sister is a nurse.

questions.question: Are you a student?
incorrectAnswers: Yes, I are.
Yes, I'm.
Yes, I is.
correctAnswers: Yes, I am.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: This is my glasses over there.
These are my glasses over there.
That is my glasses over there.
correctAnswers: Those are my glasses over there.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: They like them dinner.
They like there dinner.
They like theirs dinner.
correctAnswers: They like their dinner.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Tom will help ours.
Tom will help our.
Tom will help for we.
correctAnswers: Tom will help us.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: James spends much time learning French.
James spends many time learning French.
James spends a lot time learning French.
correctAnswers: James spends a lot of time learning French.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: I eat fruits and vegetables every day.
I eat the fruit and vegetables every day.
I eat the fruit and the vegetables every day.
correctAnswers: I eat fruit and vegetables every day.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Helen has a long hair.
Helen has long hairs.
Helen has the long hair.
correctAnswers: Helen has long hair.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: He has many interestings books.
He has many books interesting.
He has many interested books.
correctAnswers: He has many interesting books.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Linda live in New York.
Linda lives at New York.
Linda live on New York.
correctAnswers: Linda lives in New York.

questions.question: Which answer is correct? Do you like tea?
incorrectAnswers: Yes, I like.
Yes, I am.
Yes, I does.
correctAnswers: Yes, I do.

questions.question: Which question is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Where Michael is from?
Where from is Michael?
Where's is Michael from?
correctAnswers: Where is Michael from?

questions.question: Which question is correct?
incorrectAnswers: How often you visit your granny?
How often visit you your granny?
How often you do visit your granny?
correctAnswers: How often do you visit your granny?

questions.question: Which question is correct?
incorrectAnswers: She eats oranges never.
She never doesn't eat oranges.
She eats never oranges.
correctAnswers: She never eats oranges.

questions.question: Which question is correct?
incorrectAnswers: My wife name's Emma.
My wifes' name's Emma.
My wife's names Emma.
correctAnswers: My wife's name's Emma.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: That shop is at the street's end.
That shop is in the end of the street.
That shop is in the street's end.
correctAnswers: That shop is at the end of the street.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: The job interview is on 10 a.m. on Wednesday morning.
The job interview is at 10 a.m. at Wednesday morning.
The job interview is on 10 a.m. at Wednesday morning.
correctAnswers: The job interview is at 10 a.m. on Wednesday morning.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: This online store is very popular in the Internet.
This online store is very popular at the Internet..
This online store is very popular into the Internet.
correctAnswers: This online store is very popular on the Internet.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Can you to play the guitar?
Do you can play the guitar?
Do you can to play the guitar?
correctAnswers: Can you play the guitar?

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: What do you do now? - I'm listening to music.
What are you doing now? - I listen to music.
What do you do now? - I listen to music.
correctAnswers: What are you doing now? - I'm listening to music.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: What do you do? - I'm being a doctor.
What are you doing? - I'm a doctor.
What are you doing? - I'm being a doctor.
correctAnswers: What do you do? - I'm a doctor.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: You don't smoke. It's bad for your health.
Don't you smoke. It's bad for your health.
Let's smoke. It's bad for your health.
correctAnswers: Don't smoke. It's bad for your health.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Was you excited about the wedding? - Yes, I was!
Were you excited about the wedding? - Yes, I were!
Was you excited about the wedding? - Yes, I were!
correctAnswers: Were you excited about the wedding? - Yes, I was!

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Sorry, I forgeted to tell you.
Sorry, I forgotten to tell you.
Sorry, I forgoted to tell you.
correctAnswers: Sorry, I forgot to tell you.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: They didn't liked the movie at all.
They liked not the movie at all.
They weren't liked the movie at all.
correctAnswers: They didn't like the movie at all.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: She loves to travelling.
She loves to travel.
She loves travel.
correctAnswers: She loves traveling.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Would you like having dinner with us?
Would you like to have a dinner with us?
Would you like have dinner with us?
correctAnswers: Would you like to have dinner with us?

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Do you have got a car? - No, not now. But I had one.
Have you got a car? - No, not now. But I had got one.
Do you got a car? - No, not now. But I had one.
correctAnswers: Have you got a car? - No, not now. But I had one.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Can I have any water, please?
Can I have water, please?
Can I have a water, please?
correctAnswers: Can I have some water, please?

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: There are a sofa and two armchairs in the room.
Their is a sofa and two armchairs in the room.
There were a sofa and two armchairs in the room.
correctAnswers: There is a sofa and two armchairs in the room.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: There is a concert tomorrow. There will be amazing!
There is a concert tomorrow. Will be amazing!
It is a concert tomorrow. It will be amazing!
correctAnswers: There is a concert tomorrow. It will be amazing!

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Sarah is taller that them.
Sarah is taller than they.
Sarah is more taller than them.
correctAnswers: Sarah is taller than them.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Barcelona is one of most popular tourist destinations.
Barcelona is one of the most popularest tourist destinations.
Barcelona is one of the popularest tourist destinations.
correctAnswers: Barcelona is one of the most popular tourist destinations.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: I shall help you with your heavy suitcase. Shall we go?
I will help you with your heavy suitcase. Will we go?
I shall help you with your heavy suitcase. Will we go?
correctAnswers: I will help you with your heavy suitcase. Shall we go?

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: We will to visit Paris next September.
We will visit Paris next September.
We shall visit Paris next September.
correctAnswers: We are going to visit Paris next September.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: They speak English very good.
They speak English very goodly.
They speak English very best.
correctAnswers: They speak English very well.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
incorrectAnswers: Jane didn't buy food so she forgot her credit card.
Jane didn't buy food and she forgot her credit card.
Jane didn't buy food but she forgot her credit card.
correctAnswers: Jane didn't buy food because she forgot her credit card.
